text: Many, many years ago,
seems like a previous life,
I was a band director in Texas.
Did that for about eight years,
and towards the end of that road,

I was starting to get into
cloud stuff as a hobby.
I kind of realized that the hobby
was turning more into something

I could probably actually
leverage for a career change.
So I went back to school,
did an online program
to get a computer science degree.
From there, I was able to get a job
with a very large financial services firm
here in the U.S.

I've had to basically teach
myself the whole thing
with anything I could find online.
But one thing that really stuck out
was all the AWS Training and Certification

provided material that
was very well sequenced,

it helped accelerate
all of those transitions
throughout all of those phases.

One thing that really 
sticks out to me with the

AWS Skill Builder individual
learning subscription
is the labs.

I really enjoy doing labs
that take what's already there

in the free structured
certification preparation content,

and it extends it to
practical application.
In my line of work, we have to go
beyond the theory and beyond just words
on the page of training materials
and actually go into the console

and be able to build
solutions for our customers.
The Builder Labs are very helpful
to go in and just reinforce skills
that maybe have gotten stale
over several weeks and months,

that you need to just
refresh your skills on.
Cloud Quest has benefited me greatly
for just reinforcing all of the learning

from all of the free
content that is out there
on Skill Builder.
It also helps you get a little bit of fun
in your learning process

with the gamified learning
that is provided there.

I probably would not
be in the position I am
had I not used the content

that was provided by AWS
Training and Certification.

It's helped me achieve
several certifications
so I can help people achieve
the same level of professional growth
that I've been working towards.
